articles.title: Roly-poly multiplayer brawler Party Animals aims to make you laugh yourself to death
articles.author: Bree Royce
articles.excerpt: There is something about this game that makes our team act like goofy weirdos every time we see a trailer or get a press release: It's Party Animals, and it's the game where roly-poly animals trundle…
articles.summary:
There is something about this game that makes our team act like goofy weirdos every time we see a trailer or get a press release: It's 
Party Animals
, and it's the game where roly-poly animals trundle around wrecking each other with bizarre objects.


Last night, Recreate Games apologized for the 'prolonged wait' since the 2020 demo and announced that 
Party Animals
 is launching on September 20th, coming to both PC and Xbox (Xbox One and X|S). It comes with a $20 pricetag, and it is not an MMO, mind you, but it's multiplayer; the studio's been calling it a co-op brawler, but the devs told us last night that it includes online co-op and multiple game modes that pit teams against each other, so maybe co-op isn't exactly the right word here for what is basically team PvP.
articles.authors: Bree Royce,Move Comment,You Are Going To Send Email To

articles.title: Hyper Light Breaker devs say you can think of their open-world roguelike as Breath of the Wild meets Hades, and I certainly want to
articles.author: Austin Wood
articles.excerpt: Explore alone or with friends as you assemble the perfect build in the Overgrowth
articles.summary:
(Image credit: Heart Machine)






Roguelike open-world RPG Hyper Light Breaker dropped a new trailer during today's Summer Game Fest Day of the Devs presentation as part of not-
E3 2023
, and its uncommon genre mish-mash somehow makes sense filtered through the uncanny style of developer Heart Machine.
"It's a huge, stylish, bloody game," creative director Alx Preston says in the new showcase. "As is our MO, it's a game that's vivid but bleak, with a crumbing world that can be brutal and beautiful all at once.

articles.title: SpiderHeck 'Quality of Heck' update and more showcased
articles.author: rawmeatcowboy
articles.excerpt: A sticky situation
articles.summary:
Spiderheck is a frantic and fast-paced game where spiders with hats and laser swords battle to the death. Also, there is parkour!
 
In this video, the dev team will be taking you through the development plans they have for SpiderHeck at the moment, including multiplayer.
 
SpiderHeck is a fast-paced couch co-op brawler where spiders battle it out in a deadly dance of chaos. Choose to take on waves of ferocious enemies as a lone wolf (spider), or join forces with your friends, then challenge them to a duel afterwards so you can gleefully watch them do a neat trick before they launch themselves face-first into the lava.

articles.title: Hyper Light Breaker surprises us with new gameplay of its co-op roguelite
articles.author: Alberto Garrido
articles.excerpt: Hyper Light Drifter sequel shows its progress in Day of the Devs.
articles.summary:
news



 
One of the biggest announcements at the Day of the Devs indies conference came from Heart Machine, creators of Hyper Light Drifter, with a new gameplay trailer for its direct sequel, .
 It's a colourful roguelite narrative adventure in which we play as Breaker, a mercenary tasked with a mission to enter Overgrowth, a world in disarray within the Hyper Light universe. Alone or with up to two companions, we will explore large procedurally generated biomes in an open world with brutal monsters and mysterious bosses known as Crowns in an attempt to overthrow the ominous King of the Abyss.

articles.title: Call of Duty Modern Warfare III Can Save Warzone and Here's How
articles.author: Mintu Tomar
articles.excerpt: Activision's upcoming, rumored premium installment Call of Duty Modern Warfare III has a potential to revive Warzone from its dead state.
articles.summary:
Call of Duty
 Warzone 2 has been struggling to attract fans ever since its debut last year. The ongoing state of the battle royale has been nothing less than misery. Due to the unnecessary changes implemented in the sequel, players haven't liked its overall experience, simply because it's a far cry from the original Warzone.
However, everything's still not lost for the game of the ‘new era' of Call of Duty. There are still hopes of a silver lining, in the form of a rumored, new premium game in the franchise.

articles.title: There's another zombie co-op shooter coming, but this one has John Carpenter's name on it
articles.author: Alice Bell
articles.excerpt: John Carpenter's Toxic Commando is another co-op zombie FPS, but vaguely 80s themed and you can drive an ambulance into a horde of undead
articles.summary:
Over the last 18 months or so I have found myself asking, "how often must we play a new co-op zombie shooter?" and the answer has always been "at least once more". It seems to have been one of those things where a few years back a bunch of devs all noticed that there hadn't been one for a while, but didn't realise they weren't the only ones to have noticed until the games all started coming out. Anyway, Saber Interactive revealed John Carpenter's Toxic Commando, to be published by Focus Entertainment, at tonight's 
Summer Game Fest
.

articles.title: My Time At Sandrock Gets A September Switch Release Date, Online Co-op To Follow
articles.author: Gavin Lane
articles.excerpt: My Time has come
articles.summary:
Pathea Games' long-awaited follow-up to My Time at Portia has finally got a console launch date: My Time at Sandrock will be coming to Switch (and other consoles such as the *checks notes* Sony PlayStation 5 and Microsoft Xboxes) on .

The game has been in Early Access on Steam since May 2022 but console gamers have been playing the waiting game with this one. Described as an adventure RPG set in "a wholesome post-apocalyptic world", the team at Pathea is aware of the performance-based shortcomings of the previous game on Switch — as discussed when we briefly went hands-on with a PC build of Sandrock at PAX East last year — so we've got our fingers crossed that this long-in-development sequel will be a solid performer out of the gate on Nintendo's console.

articles.title: Everything shown at the Day of the Devs SGF 2023 showcase
articles.author: More Stories Eric Van Allen
articles.excerpt: From brand-new reveals to exciting updates, here's all of the indie news we saw from this year's Day of the Devs showcase at SGF 2023.
articles.summary:
Today, Double Fine and iam8bit aired another installment of Day of the Devs. It's a regular celebration of indie games, shining a spotlight on upcoming games and their creators.
 
The Day of the Devs selections usually don't disappoint, and this year's Day of the Devs held after the Summer Game Fest 2023 kick-off stream was solid. Alongside some games we knew of beforehand, there were some exciting new announcements, both from known creators and newer teams in the scene.
 
From the 
Chicory 
team's latest endeavor to a mind-bending world-moving puzzle game, there's a little something of everything.

articles.title: Council Post: Distributed Tracing: The Key To Microservices Observability
articles.author: Maya Mandel
articles.excerpt: If this 'microservices sprawl' is not managed, it can result in development latency and subpar performance.
articles.summary:
Maya is VP Product at 
Helios
, a dev-first observability platform that helps dev and ops teams improve the reliability of distributed apps.


getty
 
Distributed tracing, a technique used to identify performance issues in complex distributed systems, has become a boon for modern app development. It's not only helping developers make sure their apps are running more smoothly, but it's also improving developer productivity.
 
Modern apps have become increasingly complex, often spanning dozens of microservices and cloud components (DBs, queues, etc.

articles.title: Everything announced at Day of the Devs: Summer Game Fest Edition
articles.author: Ozzie Mejia
articles.excerpt: Here's a full recap of the upcoming indie titles revealed during the Day of the Devs: Summer Game Fest Edition presentation.
articles.summary:
Here's a full recap of the upcoming indie titles revealed during the Day of the Devs: Summer Game Fest Edition presentation.
 
 
 


 
Following an announcement-filled presentation from Geoff Keighley's Summer Game Fest, it was time for Day of the Devs to take center stage. The best of the indies were on display during Day of the Devs: SGF Edition. Many of the reveals were new, though there were a few updates on some previously revealed titles, including one that has been in the works for more than a decade.

articles.title: What Day Of The Devs Revealed During Summer Game Fest 2023
articles.author: Gavin Sheehan
articles.excerpt: Shortly after the Summer Game Fest 2023 livestream, Day of the Devs took over and hilighted several titles for a solid hour.
articles.summary:
Posted in: 
Games
, 
Indie Games
, 
Video Games
 | Tagged: 
Day Of The Devs
, 
indie games
, 
Summer Game Fest
Shortly after the Summer Game Fest 2023 livestream, Day of the Devs took over and hilighted several titles for a solid hour.
Taking place shortly after 
Summer Game Fest
 held its two-hour livestream, 
Day Of The Devs
 took over and highlighted several indie games. The event showed off 15 different titles from indie studios around the world, a few of them already known, but the vast majority of them had not been seen by the public until that moment.

articles.title: There is a chance the upcoming Terraria board game could be good
articles.author: Matt Cox
articles.excerpt: A crowdfunder is coming, but a lucky few did get to try an early alpha prototype at the UK board games expo last weekend.
articles.summary:
Dig deep, for both mental fortitude and coin, because yet another videogame is getting the cardboard treatment. Paper Fort Games are transmuting beloved mine and craft ‘em up 
Terraria
 into a 4 player co-op board game, albeit one that's on the distant horizon. A crowdfunder is coming and the devs 'don't expect' the game will ship this year, but a lucky few did get to try an early alpha prototype at the UK board games expo last weekend. Somewhat surprisingly, they seemed to like it.
The official announcement
 speaks of 'faithfully combining the digital game's biome exploration, character progression, base building and epic combat with tabletop mechanisms - alongside a fresh new art style'.

articles.title: Day of the Devs 2023: Everything Announced
articles.author: Adam BankhurstPosted:
articles.excerpt: From Cocoon to Hauntii to Été to Hyper Light Breaker, here is everything that was announced and revealed at Day of the Devs 2023.
articles.summary:
While Summer Game Fest may be the big ticket show, Day of the Devs deserves just as much attention as it is filled with incredible indie games from developers around the world that are creating some of the most creative and unique experiences around. 
This year's show was no different and featured 15 games, including another look at Cocoon, which is the upcoming puzzle-adventure game from one of the designers of Inside and Limbo. We were also treated to a game called Hauntii, which stars a ghost who can haunt objects and use their abilities, and Été, which promises to deliver a black-and-white world that begs for you to add color to it.

articles.title: All Of The Games From Day Of The Devs 2023
articles.author: Kieron Verbrugge
articles.excerpt: All Of The Games From Day Of The Devs 2023
articles.summary:
Along with a stacked 
Summer Game Fest
 showcase comes even more reveal events to follow, with the Double Fine/iam8bit-hosted Day of the Devs tailing Geoff Keighley's show with a look at 15 fantastic upcoming indie games.


The slate this year is incredible across the board, so if you missed checking it all out live, here's what was featured:


Day Of The Devs Showcase 2023


HYPER LIGHT BREAKER


Enter the Overgrowth, a forgotten land in the world of Hyper Light. Play alone or with friends to explore open worlds, fight brutal monsters, unlock gear, create new builds, take on the mysterious Crowns and overthrow the ominous Abyss King in this adventure from the creators of Hyper Light Drifter.

articles.title: Sonic Superstars really is bringing something totally new to the 32-year-old series
articles.author: Dom Peppiatt
articles.excerpt: Sega announced a new Sonic game at Summer Games Fest, but more information has come to light about why it's actually going to be exciting.
articles.summary:
When you boot up a 
Sonic
 game – whether it's one of the GOAT'd original trilogy titles for the Mega Drive, or one of the lesser-regarded 3D titles of the latter years – you know it's a Sonic game. Those sharps lines that denote speed giving way to parabolic swoops and curves, the intense green of nature set against the weird orange of manufactured brick... Sonic has an instantly recognisable identity. And has had for over three decades.


The same is true of 
Sonic Superstars
 – the new game annuonced by Sega at this week's 
Summer Games Fest
.

articles.title: How to Build Successful DevOps Teams
articles.author: Mariusz Tomczyk
articles.excerpt: Mariusz Tomczyk and other DevOps professionals offer their advice on how to build successful DevOps teams and plug talent gaps.
articles.summary:
The DevOps sector is still in urgent need of new talent, with 
38% of tech companies
 stating that they struggle to find 
skilled developers
 in 2023. These same respondents named DevOps as the number-one area where they are feeling the pinch. Because of this, businesses must ensure they prioritize and nurture the right set of core skills when building DevOps teams.
Below, we discuss the key qualities that businesses should look for when taking on new DevOps engineers and what leaders can do to get the most out of existing employees.
articles.authors: Andrew Manby,Brenna Washington,Don Macvittie,Gilad David Maayan,Javier Perez,Jt Giri,Karolina Junčytė,Mariusz Tomczyk,Mike Vizard,Richi Jennings
